name: Achimota School
about: Achimota School, also known as Motown, is one of the oldest and most prestigious schools in Ghana. It was established in 1924 and has a rich history of academic excellence and notable alumni.
achievements: Achimota School has produced many prominent leaders in Ghana and beyond, including former presidents, diplomats, and professionals in various fields.

name: Wesley Girls' High School
about: Wesley Girls' High School is a highly respected all-girls school founded in 1836. It is known for its strong academic performance and emphasis on discipline and moral values.
achievements: The school consistently ranks among the top in national examinations and has a strong record in extracurricular activities, particularly in science and mathematics competitions.

name: Presbyterian Boys' Secondary School (PRESEC)
about: PRESEC is a prestigious boys' school established in 1938. It is renowned for its academic excellence, particularly in science and technology.
achievements: PRESEC has won the National Science and Maths Quiz multiple times and has a strong alumni network contributing to various sectors in Ghana.

name: St. Augustine's College
about: St. Augustine's College, often referred to as 'Augusco', is a prominent boys' school founded in 1930. It is known for its academic rigor and vibrant school culture.
achievements: The school has a strong track record in national examinations and sports, particularly in athletics and football.

name: Opoku Ware School
about: Opoku Ware School, also known as OWASS, is a top boys' school established in 1952. It is known for its academic excellence and strong emphasis on discipline.
achievements: OWASS has produced many notable alumni in various fields and consistently performs well in national examinations and extracurricular activities.

name: Holy Child School
about: Holy Child School is an all-girls boarding school founded in 1946. It is known for its strong academic performance and nurturing environment.
achievements: The school has a strong record in national examinations and extracurricular activities, particularly in science and arts.
